com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.rexster

Class RexsterGraph

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinkerpop.blueprints.impls.rexster.RexsterGraph
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Graph, IndexableGraph, KeyIndexableGraph, MetaGraph<org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONObject>

    public class RexsterGraph
extends Object
implements IndexableGraph, KeyIndexableGraph, MetaGraph<org.codehaus.jettison.json.JSONObject>
    A Blueprints implementation of the RESTful API of Rexster (http://rexster.tinkerpop.com).
    Author:
    Marko A. Rodriguez (http://markorodriguez.com)

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RexsterGraph(org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration configuration) 
      RexsterGraph(String graphURI)
      Construct a RexsterGraph with no authentication and default buffer size.
      RexsterGraph(String graphURI, int bufferSize)
      Construct a RexsterGraph with no authentication.
      RexsterGraph(String graphURI, int bufferSize, String username, String password)
      Construct a RexsterGraph with authentication enabled (assuming username and password are both non-null values).
      RexsterGraph(String graphURI, String username, String password)
      Construct a RexsterGraph with authentication enabled (assuming username and password are both non-null values) and default buffer size.

      • getGraphURI

        public String getGraphURI()

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        This method does nothing. To shutdown a RexsterGraph, it must be shutdown locally on the Rexster server.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Graph

        Get the size of the communication buffer.

      • setBufferSize

        public void setBufferSize(int bufferSize)
        This represents the communication buffer. The larger the buffer, the more information is marshaled back and forth.
        Parameters:
        bufferSize - the size of the buffer

      • getVertices

        public Iterable<Vertex> getVertices()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown.
        Specified by:
        getVertices in interface Graph
        Returns:
        an iterable reference to all vertices in the graph

      • getVertices

        public Iterable<Vertex> getVertices(String key,
                           Object value)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return an iterable to all the vertices in the graph that have a particular key/value property. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown. The graph implementation should use indexing structures to make this efficient else a full vertex-filter scan is required.
        Specified by:
        getVertices in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        key - the key of vertex
        value - the value of the vertex
        Returns:
        an iterable of vertices with provided key and value

      • addVertex

        public Vertex addVertex(Object id)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Create a new vertex, add it to the graph, and return the newly created vertex. The provided object identifier is a recommendation for the identifier to use. It is not required that the implementation use this identifier.
        Specified by:
        addVertex in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id - the recommended object identifier
        Returns:
        the newly created vertex

      • getVertex

        public Vertex getVertex(Object id)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return the vertex referenced by the provided object identifier. If no vertex is referenced by that identifier, then return null.
        Specified by:
        getVertex in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id - the identifier of the vertex to retrieved from the graph
        Returns:
        the vertex referenced by the provided identifier or null when no such vertex exists

      • getEdges

        public Iterable<Edge> getEdges()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown.
        Specified by:

      • getEdges

        public Iterable<Edge> getEdges(String key,
                      Object value)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Return an iterable to all the edges in the graph that have a particular key/value property. If this is not possible for the implementation, then an UnsupportedOperationException can be thrown. The graph implementation should use indexing structures to make this efficient else a full edge-filter scan is required.
        Specified by:
        getEdges in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the edge
        value - the value of the edge
        Returns:
        an iterable of edges with provided key and value

      • addEdge

        public Edge addEdge(Object id,
           Vertex outVertex,
           Vertex inVertex,
           String label)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Add an edge to the graph. The added edges requires a recommended identifier, a tail vertex, an head vertex, and a label. Like adding a vertex, the provided object identifier may be ignored by the implementation.
        Specified by:
        addEdge in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        id - the recommended object identifier
        outVertex - the vertex on the tail of the edge
        inVertex - the vertex on the head of the edge
        label - the label associated with the edge
        Returns:
        the newly created edge

      • removeVertex

        public void removeVertex(Vertex vertex)
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Remove the provided vertex from the graph. Upon removing the vertex, all the edges by which the vertex is connected must be removed as well.
        Specified by:
        removeVertex in interface Graph
        Parameters:
        vertex - the vertex to remove from the graph

      • getFeatures

        public Features getFeatures()
        Description copied from interface: Graph
        Get the particular features of the graph implementation. Not all graph implementations are identical nor perfectly implement the Blueprints API. The Features object returned contains meta-data about numerous potential divergences between implementations.
        Specified by:
        getFeatures in interface Graph
        Returns:
        the features of this particular Graph implementation
